name: Sharon Brown
statement:
**Legal/Judicial Experience**  
WA State Senate since 2013. (elected) Currently Senate Deputy Republican Leader,  
Previously Senate Vice-President Pro Tem, Member Statute and Laws Committee, Ranking member -Ways and Means Committee; Attorney, private practice-mergers, acquisitions, small business.  
  
**Other Professional Experience**  
Mayor Pro-Tem, City of Kennewick 2010 (elected to City Council)  
  
**Education**  
J.D. University of New Hampshire School of Law, Franklin Pierce Center for Intellectual Property, Certificate -Straus Institute for Dispute Resolution, Pepperdine University School of Law, BA Drew University  
  
**Community Service**  
Boys and Girls Club Board; WSU Tri Cities Advisory Board; Visit Tri-Cities Board;  
Volunteer for Domestic Violence Survivors, Anti-Human Trafficking, Suicide Prevention  
  
**Statement**  
As a business lawyer, a City Council member and Mayor Pro Tem, and finally as your State Senator for the past eight years, I have developed a broad and unique skill set to make me an outstanding judge. Since 2013 I have been creating, revising and establishing policy to become law, thus I understand the true meaning of the law, and how it should be applied. Additionally, as a trained mediator, I learned to be absolutely neutral with no bias towards one side or the other. My background as a business attorney facilitated my arguments against a proposed banking tax law that would create a burden for Washington’s small businesses. The law was ultimately struck down by the ruling of a Superior Court Judge. My judicial philosophy is to follow the law as written and to give the taxpayers a good return on their investment by having a strong work ethic. Through my eight years in the Legislature I have a rare 100% attendance record and have never missed a single vote. I pledge to dedicate that same level of effort as a Superior Court Judge for Benton and Franklin counties. I would be honored to receive your vote.
